Race.SpecificTitle: City Judge -- City Court, City of Sulphur
City Judge -- City Court, Division B, City of Lake Charles
City Marshal -- City Court, City of Lake Charles
City Marshal -- City Court, City of Sulphur
Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward  2
PW Sports Wagering -- Authorize Sports Wagering Activities - Act 215, 2020
Race.SummaryText: PROPOSITION TO AUTHORIZE SPORTS WAGERING ACTIVITIES.
Race.FullText: Shall sports wagering activities and operations be permitted in the parish of Calcasieu?

Race.SpecificTitle: Community Center & Playground Dist. No. 3 of Wd. 7 -- 3 Mills Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Community Center and Playground District No. Three of Ward Seven Proposition
(Maintenance Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Community Center and Playground District No. Three of Ward Seven of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to renew, levy and collect an ad valorem property tax of three (3) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District for ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2022 and ending December 31, 2031, for the purpose of maintaining the District swimming pool and related facilities, with $197,093.66 estimated to be collected from levy of the tax in 2022?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cons. Gravity Drainage Dist. No. 1 (W. Calcasieu) -- 4.50 Mills In Lieu - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 1 (West Calcasieu) Proposition
(Drainage Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 1 (West Calcasieu) of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to levy, and collect a tax of four and 50/100 (4.50) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the District for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2022, in lieu of and replacing the District's existing millages, and to lower the rate of tax authorized for the District by repealing the current authority to levy rates in its respective component districts of: 10.00, 4.78, and 9.27 mills, respectively, with collections from this levy estimated to be six million dollars for one entire year, for the purposes of improving drainage, including maintaining and constructing drains, drainage canals, dikes and levees, and the purchase or maintenance of equipment used in maintaining or constructing drains, outfalls, levees or pumping stations in the District, and to dedicate additional funds to capital projects to improve drainage?

Race.SpecificTitle: Consolidated Gravity Drainage Dist. No. 2 (East) -- 5.75 Mills In Lieu - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 2 (East) Proposition
(Drainage Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 2 (East) of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to levy, and collect a tax of five and 75/100 (5.75) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the District for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2022, in lieu of and replacing the District's existing millages, and to lower the rate of tax authorized for the District by repealing the current authority to levy rates in its respective component districts of: 5.79, 10.00, 11.04, and 14.60 mills, respectively, with collections from this levy estimated to be six million dollars for one entire year, for the purposes of improving drainage, including maintaining and constructing drains, drainage canals, dikes and levees, and the purchase or maintenance of equipment used in maintaining or constructing drains, outfalls, levees or pumping stations in the District, and to dedicate additional funds to capital projects to improve drainage?
